page.title: 08HESWALL SHOPS
page.content: Heswall, that used to be a hamlet with only a few shops, has grown considerably and now in 1985 there are about 140 shops. In our survey we found that the type of shops ranged from off-licences to opticians, florists to fancy goods and car show-rooms to funeral-services, but by far the greatest number of shops were those selling clothes and food because they are more essential. These amount to 30% of the total number. Some types of shop however were not very common. For example furniture shops and decorating suppliers. These shops are usually specialist in what they sell. There were however five estate agents and twelve building societies. This seems to show that there is a good house market in the area.
